description: Pressed plant specimens to be processed as herbarium vouchers.

elements.description: Site within which the plant is located. Used to filter out plants located outside of the selected site.
elements.label: Filter: Site

elements.description: The plant from which the specimen is collected from.
elements.label: Plant

elements.description: The full scientific name, with authorship if known.
elements.label: Scientific Name

elements.description: Plant Phenological stage, according to the Plant Phenology Ontology: https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fpls.2018.00517/full
elements.label: Phenology

elements.description: Photos of the plant.
elements.label: Plant Photos

elements.description: A list of names of people responsible for collecting the leaf sample. The primary collector, especially one who applies a personal identifier (Specimen ID or Barcode), should be listed first.
elements.label: Collected By

elements.description: The date when the specimen was collected.
elements.label: Date Collected

elements.description: Unique field ID for the leaf sample. Defined automatically as the Unix timestamp (= number fo seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00UTC) - 1519142458.
elements.label: Specimen ID

elements.description: A barcode or QR code that identifies the specimen.
elements.label: Specimen Barcode

elements.description:
Comments or notes about the specimen.

Not used for demographic data (e.g. abundance). Particularly useful for characters that cannot be observed on a dried, pressed specimen (e.g. plant height, bark color, flower smell).
elements.label: Specimen Remarks
elements.pattern_description: No comma ',' or semi-colon ';' due to csv

elements.description: Has the specimen been deposited in a herbarium?
elements.label: Deposited in Herbarium?

elements.description: The name of the herbarium holding the specimen.
elements.label: Herbarium Name

elements.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the herbarium collection.
elements.label: Catalog Number

elements.description: List of the most abundant plant species in the habitat.
The checklist used to provide the scientific name of the taxon.
elements.label: Taxon Checklist

elements.description: Filter the VASCAN database based on geographical distribution by selecting ONE region (e.g. Canadian province). Can be combined with growth form filter.
elements.label: VASCAN Filter: Geography

elements.description: Filter VASCAN database based by selecting ONE particular growth form. Can be combined with geography filter.
elements.label: VASCAN Filter: Growth Form

elements.description: A group of vascular plants considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit, based on the VASCAN database.
elements.label: VASCAN Taxon

elements.description: A group of bryphoytes considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit, based on the Bryoquel database.
elements.label: Bryoquel Taxon

elements.description: A group of organisms considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit,  whose taxon is not available in VASCAN or other taxonomic checklists accessible within Fulcrum.
elements.label: Generic Taxon

elements.description: The full scientific name, with authorship if known.
elements.label: Plant Scientific Name

elements.description: An English common or vernacular name.
elements.label: Vernacular Name (English)

elements.description: A French common or vernacular name.
elements.label: Vernacular Name (French)
Dominant Plant Species

elements.description: Description of the vegetation type in which the collected plant occurs. Uses the Canadian National Vegetation Classification (CVNC); http://cnvc-cnvc.ca/index.cfm.
elements.label: Vegetation Type

elements.description: Canadian National Vegetation Classification
elements.label: Vegetation Type Definitions

elements.description:
Moisture class of the soil, as defined in Table 10.2 of Canada's National Forest Inventory: Ground Sampling Guidelines.

Xeric: Water removed very rapidly in relation to supply; soil is moist for brief periods following precipitation. The primary water source is precipitation.

Mesic: Water is removed somewhat slowly in relation to supply; soil may remain moist for a significant, but sometimes short, period of the year. Available soil moisture reflects climatic inputs. The primary water source is precipitation in moderate to fine-textured soils and limited seepage in coarse-textured soils.

Hygric: Water is removed so slowly that the water table is at or above the soil all year; gleyed mineral or organic soils. The primary water source is a permanent water table.
elements.label: Soil Moisture Class

elements.description: Comments or notes about the habitat.
elements.label: Habitat Remarks
elements.pattern_description: No comma ',' or semi-colon ';' due to csv

elements.description: Audio comments about the habitat.
elements.label: Audio Remarks

elements.description: Photos of the habitat.
elements.label: Habitat Photos

name: Pressed Specimens

status_field.description: Status of record. Record first requires verification. Once verified, it can be submitted for approval; this locks the record for standard users. If approved, the record eventually gets published. If rejected, it goes back to standard users for further verification.
status_field.label: Record Status
